Detailed Description

Offers a function to read in input patterns and the corresponding target values for a network from a file.

Function Documentation

void loadOrganizedData ( const std::string &  filename,
const unsigned  id,
const unsigned  od,
Array< double > &  in,
Array< double > &  out 
)

Used to read input patterns and their corresponding target values from a file.

The data for input patterns and the corresponding target values is read from a file and stored in two arrays, that can be used as direct input for networks.
Each line of the file will contain the values for one input pattern, followed by the corresponding target values for this pattern. The single values must be separated by whitespaces.

Parameters:
filename The name of the file, from which the data is read.
id The input dimension, i.e. the no. of input neurons.
od The output dimension, i.e. the no. of output neurons.
in The input patterns will be stored here.
out The target patterns will be stored here.
Returns:
none.
Example
  #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
  #include "ReClaM/IOTools.h"

  void main()
  {
      Array< double > input, target;

      loadOrganizedData( "test.dat", 4, 2, input, target );

      cout << "input patterns:" << endl;
      writeArray( input, cout );
      cout << "\ntarget values:" << endl;
      writeArray( target, cout );
  }
If "test.dat" has the following content:

then the example program will produce the output:
